item.title: Bose's Bluetooth speakers and headphones simplify the process of making connections
item.description: Bose has expanded its SoundLink mobile audio lineup with two new products: the SoundLink Color Bluetooth speaker, their most budget-friendly SoundLink speaker yet, and the SoundLink Bluetooth on-ear headphones, Bose’s first foray into on-ear Bluetooth headphones. The SoundLink Color Bluetooth speaker features a brand new design. Weighing in at 1.25 pounds (567g), it measures 5 inches wide, 2.1 inches deep, and 5.3 inches high. Bose has engineered the speaker with dual-opposing passive radiators and two high-efficiency transducers to deliver powerful, full-range sound, including impressive bass performance.

item.title: Cisco Steps In Front Of The Video Parade
item.description: John Naisbitt, a renowned futurist, once said that true leadership involves recognizing a trend and positioning oneself at its forefront. Cisco seems to have taken this to heart by acquiring Flip Video, the company behind the wildly popular camcorder line. It appears Cisco sees consumer-generated video as a growing trend and intends to lead the charge. But what exactly are their plans? To understand Cisco’s strategy, it’s crucial to examine the Flip video camera’s impact on the camcorder market.

item.title: JVC introduces new sports in-ear headphones that are waterproof and washable
item.description: Source: JVC. JVC introduces four new sports headphone options designed to stay securely in place during physical activity, with some models offering waterproof and washable features. The lineup includes two models in both the JVC Gumy Sport and Extreme Fitness series. The Gumy Sport headphones, HA-EN10 and HA-ENR15, utilize a Nozzle Fit earpiece constructed from soft silicone. This unique shape ensures a secure and comfortable fit, preventing the headphones from falling out during workouts.
